author: jochembrouwer
content: I have a small side-question regarding EOF, is there any discussion already about how we will report JSON traces when running EOF? (In context of `debug_trace*`?)

author: _shemnon
content: EIP-3155 will need an update.  What i've done is (a) if the code is EOF, adding a `section="#"`  field, and (b) if the arg has an immediate adding an `"immediate":"0xXXXX"` to show the immediate data (except RJUMPV, that just gets the table size)

author: _shemnon
content: Here is a trace from the EEST test tests/prague/eip7692_eof_v1/eip3540_eof_v1/test_execution_function.py::test_eof_functions_contract_call_succeed[fork_Prague-state_test-function_finishes_contract_execution]

author: _shemnon
content: I really want to migrate the "op" field to hex

author: jochembrouwer
content: RETURNDATALOAD has the same opcode as AUTHCALL, is this correct?

author: jochembrouwer
content: I assume we need EXTAUTHCALL then or something?

author: _shemnon
content: When we divied up opode locations 3074 was not viable.

author: _shemnon
content: No, I expect 3074 to be dropped in favor of 7702.

author: marioevz
content:
Hey <@403707149043105803> I created a PR to your branch for the EXCHANGE tests: https://github.com/shemnon/execution-spec-tests/pull/2

I added an encoder to `EXCHANGE` opcode, which is described in the PR, and also some negative tests

author: racytech
content: Hey everyone, how can I test if the EOF implementation is working properly? Are there tests for EOF? I want to develop by testing

author: chfast
content:
https://github.com/ipsilon/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/eof-20240515

and also ethereum/tests has a lot, try this branch: https://github.com/ipsilon/tests/tree/eof-notxcreate

author: marioevz
content:
Hi <@425274498732916736> <@403707149043105803> <@275684146658148352> I created https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/573 to verify EOF PRs using tox, by compiling evmone and using it to fill EOF state tests and also verify using `emvone-eofparse`.

Also `fixtures_eof.tar.gz` is now also automatically created on releases, or by running the github action manually, which should make it easier to produce the test fixtures for other clients to consume.
